content.description: Starts on good holds just above two chicken heads (starting here may add 1/2 - 1 grade). Work your way up to finish to the left of the massive, protruding jug at the top of the UFO feature. Making a big move left and finishing to the right of this jug is UFO Right (V7).
content.location: In the UFO roof. One of the really good problems in the cave.

content.description: Sit start on the lowest chalked holds and work your way up through slimpers, sidepulls, and a pocket to the drop off jug.
content.location: Middle right side of the cave. To the right of Kryptonite and left of Ghetto Methods.

content.description: Start as for covert methods then climb out the roof via a huge move to a sloping crimp and another large move to an edge then pop to a bucket and drop off. Hard for v4? Doubtful cause everything I've seen grades it v3. However it feels harder than the 6s and 7s on this cliff.
content.location: Start as for covert methods and climb right

content.description: Sit start on a side pull and right hand crimp rail. Move out on good punches and edges straight up to the jug at the lip.
content.location: A few yards right of the UFO feature. Start is in the low right side of the small cave next to the UFO.

content.description: Start on jugs just left of the Monopolist. Go straight up through side pulls and some foot trickery to the break and drop off.
Start low on sloping rail in right side of main roof. Climb up to jugs and drop-off.

Sit start in the back of the cave to the right of Covert Methods. Work through some tension moves to a large undercling jug. Bust right into a crimp rail and finish straight up. Going right is Shame and Money (V4).
content.location: The cave to the right of Covert Methods, which is the first boulder encountered from the trail.

content.description: Start as per Covert Methods but work straight up, culminating in a big move to the jug rail. Drop off.
Start on jug and climb straight out a line of crimps and pockets to jugs at the top.
content.location: Left most side of the big roof. You walk under this thing when you enter the cave.

content.description: Sit start on edges and work your way out along the overhanging dihedral/arete feature. Harder than it looks.
content.location: Start is the on the chalked line to the right of Ghetto Methods.

content.description: Start on two pinches throw to obvious sloper then go to jug
content.location: End of the ufo left youâ€™ll find an obvious large sloper, start on pinches below, a two move boulder

content.description:
Easy, 3 move route with jugs. Good for getting used to outdoor rock texture. About the easiest thing at The Cove.

Start in a chest/head height jug. Move up and to the right into another jug. Go out left to an easy sloper, then finish on a side pull out to your right and match to finish.
content.location: Go all the way to the right side of The Cove (continue outside of the cove to get there). You'll see a vertical crack - start on the left side in a jug at about chest/head height.

content.description: Start in a slot jug in the middle of the roof. Hit a pinch out right and find a way to get to the jug drop off.
content.location: Between Fame and Money and the obvious UFO feature in the middle of the cave.
